title: run&rerun --explicit  should fail to run if specified input(s) are dirty

labels.name: cmd-run/rerun
labels.description: Issues about the favorite command of ReproPeople

body:
even it is somewhat not contradicting --explicit doc:

```
  --explicit            Consider the specification of inputs and outputs to be explicit. Don't warn if the repository
                        is dirty, and only save modifications to the listed outputs.
```

i.e. it doesn't promise checking inputs/outputs specifically at all, I think it would actually be undesirable behavior.  AFAIK --explicit was largely introduced to facilitate execution in a dirty tree on a subset of files, which are not dirty themselves. But it seems we indeed just completely disregard the state and just run:

<details>
<summary>trivial reproducer (for rerun)</summary> 

```shell
#!/bin/bash

export PS4='> '

set -eu
cd "$(mktemp -d ${TMPDIR:-/tmp}/dl-XXXXXXX)"
topd=`pwd`

datalad create src
(cd src; 
datalad run --input .datalad/config --output output bash -c 'wc {inputs} >| {outputs}'
# modify input
echo '' >> .datalad/config

git diff .datalad/config | grep -q .  # fail if no diff

datalad rerun --explicit  && { echo should have failed since input is dirty; exit 1; }
)
```
</details>

and here is the `run` in the same scenario of dirty input:
```
(git-annex)lena:~/.tmp/dl-u494MvA/src[master]git-annex
$> git status
On branch master
Changes not staged for commit:
  (use "git add <file>..." to update what will be committed)
  (use "git restore <file>..." to discard changes in working directory)
	modified:   .datalad/config

no changes added to commit (use "git add" and/or "git commit -a")

$> datalad run  --explicit --input .datalad/config --output output bash -c 'wc {inputs} >| {outputs}'
[INFO   ] Making sure inputs are available (this may take some time) 
unlock(ok): output (file)
[INFO   ] == Command start (output follows) ===== 
[INFO   ] == Command exit (modification check follows) ===== 
add(ok): output (file)                                                                                                  
save(ok): . (dataset)                                                                                                   
action summary:                                                                                                         
  add (ok: 1)
  get (notneeded: 1)
  save (ok: 1)
  unlock (ok: 1)
```

datalad 0.13.7-641-g82f2fcbc7 (master)

WDYT -- should we add guards or just let it be as is?
